de.mixedfx.file

Class FileObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mixedfx.file.FileObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class FileObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
     Provides a class to create an Object representing a File or Folder but only contains Strings.
 Also contains methods to get elements of this File representation such as path, name and extension!
 Overwritten methods: equals(), toString() and clone() method!
 Read the JavaDoc of the methods to produce no undesired results!

    • Field Detail

      • prefixSeparator

        public static java.lang.String prefixSeparator
        The separator between the prefix and the name in the file name. As soon as this parameter is modified, all actions taken on a FileObject will deal with the new one. Default: "###"

      • extensionSeparator

        public static java.lang.String extensionSeparator
        The separator between the name and the extension in the file name. As soon as this parameter is modified, all actions taken on a FileObject will deal with the new one. Default: "."

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileObject

        public FileObject()
         Fills all available values with empty Strings.
 Please fill manually the values via:
 setPath(String)
 setPrefix(String)
 setName(String)
 setExtension(String)
 or:
 setPath(String)
 setFullName(String)

      • FileObject

        public FileObject(java.io.File file)
        Converts a file to a FileObject. See also FileObject().
        Parameters:
        file - The file or folder which shall be used to create the FileObject

      • toFile

        public java.io.File toFile()

        Returns the URI representation of this FileObject

      • equalsNameSize

        public boolean equalsNameSize(FileObject toCompare)
        Compares file/folder size and name (ignoring case). It doesn't compare the getFullPath().
        Parameters:
        toCompare -
        Returns:
        Returns true if size and name is equal.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(FileObject toCompare)
        Compares file/folder fullPath via getFullPath() comparison.
        Parameters:
        toCompare - The FileObject to compare.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the FileObject is the same ignoring case.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks if getFullPath() is valid. This means the criterias of the os apply.
        Returns:
        boolean True if it fulfills the criterias, false if not.

        public void clear()
        All set attributes are deleted.

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        ATTENTION: If this object represents a directory use getFullPath() instead to get reliably the full path!
        Returns:
        Returns only the path!

      • getFullPath

        public java.lang.String getFullPath()

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        Returns the name without prefix and without extension

      • getFullNameWithoutExtension

        public java.lang.String getFullNameWithoutExtension()
        Returns:
        Returns the name with prefix and without extension

      • getFullName

        public java.lang.String getFullName()
        Returns:
        Returns the name with prefix and with extension

      • setName

        public FileObject setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name excluding directory, prefix and extension.
        Parameters:
        name - File/Folder name without prefix without extension

      • setFullName

        public FileObject setFullName(java.lang.String name)
        !!! Overwrites all previously set values!
        Parameters:
        name - File/Folder name with/without prefix with/without extension, but without the (parent) directory

      • getExtension

        public java.lang.String getExtension()
        Returns:
        Returns the extension without separator

      • getFullExtension

        public java.lang.String getFullExtension()
        Returns:
        Returns separator + extension

      • setExtension

        public FileObject setExtension(java.lang.String extension)
        Parameters:
        extension - Set the file extension with/without separator, e. g. ".png" or only "png"
